static java.lang.String OPT_CARET_COORD_MODE
          Sets the way coords are used in the caret functions, either absolute coords or coords relative to the current active window:
0 = relative coords to the active window,
1 = absolute screen coordinates (default),
2 = relative coords to the client area of the active window.

SW_RESTORE

public static final int SW_RESTORE
Activates and displays the window. If the window is minimized or maximized, the system restores it to its original size and position. An application should specify this flag when restoring a minimized window.

Activates and displays a window. If the window is minimized or maximized, the system restores it to its original size and position. An application should specify this flag when displaying the window for the first time.

OPT_CARET_COORD_MODE

public static final java.lang.String OPT_CARET_COORD_MODE
Sets the way coords are used in the caret functions, either absolute coords or coords relative to the current active window:
0 = relative coords to the active window,
1 = absolute screen coordinates (default),
2 = relative coords to the client area of the active window.

Constant Field Values

OPT_SEND_CAPSLOCK_MODE

public static final java.lang.String OPT_SEND_CAPSLOCK_MODE
Specifies if AutoIt attaches input threads when using then Send() function. When not attaching (default mode=0) detecting the state of capslock/scrolllock and numlock can be unreliable under NT4. However, when you specify attach mode=1 the Send("{... down/up}") syntax will not work and there may be problems with sending keys to "hung" windows. ControlSend() ALWAYS attaches and is not affected by this mode.
0 = don't attach (default)
1 = attach

See Also:
Constant Field Values

OPT_SEND_KEY_DELAY

public static final java.lang.String OPT_SEND_KEY_DELAY
Specifies if AutoIt should store the state of capslock before a Send function and restore it afterwards.
0 = don't store/restore
1 = store and restore (default)

See Also:
Constant Field Values

OPT_SEND_KEY_DOWN_DELAY

public static final java.lang.String OPT_SEND_KEY_DOWN_DELAY
Alters the length of time a key is held down before released during a keystroke. For applications that take a while to register keypresses (and many games) you may need to raise this value from the default. Time in milliseconds to pause (default=1).

See Also:
Constant Field Values

OPT_WIN_DETECT_HIDDEN_TEXT

public static final java.lang.String OPT_WIN_DETECT_HIDDEN_TEXT
Specifies if hidden window text can be "seen" by the window matching functions.
0 = Do not detect hidden text (default)
1 = Detect hidden text

See Also:
Constant Field Values

OPT_WIN_SEARCH_CHILDREN

public static final java.lang.String OPT_WIN_SEARCH_CHILDREN
Allows the window search routines to search child windows as well as top-level windows.
0 = Only search top-level windows (default)
1 = Search top-level and child windows

See Also:
Constant Field Values

OPT_WIN_TEXT_MATCH_MODE

public static final java.lang.String OPT_WIN_TEXT_MATCH_MODE
Alters the method that is used to match window text during search operations.
1 = Complete / Slow mode (default)
2 = Quick mode In quick mode AutoIt can usually only "see" dialog text, button text and the captions of some controls. In the default mode much more text can be seen (for instance the contents of the Notepad window). If you are having performance problems when performing many window searches then changing to the "quick" mode may help.

See Also:
Constant Field Values

OPT_WIN_TITLE_MATCH_MODE

public static final java.lang.String OPT_WIN_TITLE_MATCH_MODE
Alters the method that is used to match window titles during search operations.
1 = Match the title from the start (default)
2 = Match any substring in the title
3 = Exact title match
4 = Advanced mode, see Window Titles & Text (Advanced)

See Also:
Constant Field Values

driveMapAdd

public boolean driveMapAdd(java.lang.String device,
                           java.lang.String remote)
Maps a network drive.

Doesn't always work

Parameters:
device - The device to map, for example "O:" or "LPT1:". If you pass a blank string for this parameter a connection is made but not mapped to a specific drive. If you specify "*" an unused drive letter will be automatically selected.
remote - The remote share to connect to in the form "\\server\share".
Returns:
True if success, false otherwise

                           java.lang.String username,
                           java.lang.String password)
Maps a network drive.

Verify Works

Parameters:
device - The device to map, for example "O:" or "LPT1:". If you pass a blank string for this parameter a connection is made but not mapped to a specific drive. If you specify "*" an unused drive letter will be automatically selected.
remote - The remote share to connect to in the form "\\server\share".
flags - A combination of the following:0 = default, 1 = Persistant mapping, 8 = Show authentication dialog if required
username - The username
password - The password
Returns:
True if success, false otherwise

pixelChecksum

public double pixelChecksum(int left,
                            int top,
                            int right,
                            int bottom,
                            int step)
Generates a checksum for a region of pixels.

Parameters:
left - Left coordinate of rectangle.
top - Top coordinate of rectangle.
right - Right coordinate of rectangle.
bottom - Bottom coordinate of rectangle.
step - Instead of checksumming each pixel use a value larger than 1 to skip pixels (for speed). E.g. A value of 2 will only check every other pixel. Default is 1.
Returns:
The checksum value of the region.

pixelSearch

public long[] pixelSearch(int left,
                          int top,
                          int right,
                          int bottom,
                          int color,
                          int shadeVariation,
                          int step)
Searches a rectangle of pixels for the pixel color provided.

Parameters:
left - left coordinate of rectangle.
top - top coordinate of rectangle.
right - right coordinate of rectangle.
bottom - bottom coordinate of rectangle.
color - Colour value of pixel to find (in decimal or hex).
shadeVariation - A number between 0 and 255 to indicate the allowed number of shades of variation of the red, green, and blue components of the colour. Default is 0 (exact match).
step - Instead of searching each pixel use a value larger than 1 to skip pixels (for speed). E.g. A value of 2 will only check every other pixel. Default is 1.
Returns:
The pixel's coordinates in a 2 element array, otherwise sets .error() to one.

button - The button to click: "left", "right", "middle", "main", "menu", "primary", "secondary".
x - The x/y coordinates to move the mouse to. If no x and y coords are given, the current position is used.
y - The x/y coordinates to move the mouse to. If no x and y coords are given, the current position is used.
clicks - The number of times to click the mouse. Default is 1.
speed - The speed to move the mouse in the range 1 (fastest) to 100 (slowest). A speed of 0 will move the mouse instantly. Default speed is 10.

mouseClick

public void mouseClick(java.lang.String button,
                       int clicks,
                       int speed)
Perform a mouse click operation.

Parameters:
button - The button to click: "left", "right", "middle", "main", "menu", "primary", "secondary".
clicks - The number of times to click the mouse. Default is 1.
speed - The speed to move the mouse in the range 1 (fastest) to 100 (slowest). A speed of 0 will move the mouse instantly. Default speed is 10.

                           int x,
                           int y,
                           int x2,
                           int y2,
                           int speed)

Parameters:
button - The button to click: "left", "right", "middle", "main", "menu", "primary", "secondary".
x - The x/y coords to start the drag operation from.
y - The x/y coords to start the drag operation from.
x2 - The x/y coords to start the drag operation to.
y2 - The x/y coords to start the drag operation to.
speed - The speed to move the mouse in the range 1 (fastest) to 100 (slowest). A speed of 0 will move the mouse instantly. Default speed is 10.

mouseGetCursor

public int mouseGetCursor()
Returns a cursor ID Number of the current Mouse Cursor.

Returns:
0 = UNKNOWN (this includes pointing and grabbing hand icons)
1 = APPSTARTING
2 = ARROW
3 = CROSS
4 = HELP
5 = IBEAM
6 = ICON
7 = NO
8 = SIZE
9 = SIZEALL
10 = SIZENESW
11 = SIZENS
12 = SIZENWSE
13 = SIZEWE
14 = UPARROW
15 = WAIT

public int processExists(java.lang.String process)

Returns:
The PID of the process. 0 if process does not exist.

processSetPriority

public boolean processSetPriority(java.lang.String process,
                                  int priority)
Changes the priority of a process

Parameters:
process - The name or PID of the process to check.
priority - A flag which determines what priority to set
0 - Idle/Low
1 - Below Normal (Not supported on Windows 95/98/ME)
2 - Normal
3 - Above Normal (Not supported on Windows 95/98/ME)
4 - High
5 - Realtime (Use with caution, may make the system unstable)
Returns:
True if success, false otherwise.

timeout - Specifies how long to wait (default is to wait indefinitely).
Returns:
True if success, false otherwise.

run

public int run(java.lang.String filename,
               java.lang.String workingDirectory,
               int flag)
Runs an external program.

Parameters:
filename - The name of the executable (EXE, BAT, COM, or PIF) to run.
workingDirectory - The working directory.
flag - The "show" flag of the executed program:
SW_HIDE = Hidden window
SW_MINIMIZE = Minimized window
SW_MAXIMIZE = Maximized window
Returns:
The PID of the process that was launched. After running the requested program the script continues. To pause execution of the script until the spawned program has finished use the RunWait function instead. The error property is set to 1 as an indication of failure.

               java.lang.String workingDirectory)

Parameters:
filename - The name of the executable (EXE, BAT, COM, or PIF) to run.
workingDirectory - The working directory.
Returns:
The PID of the process that was launched. After running the requested program the script continues. To pause execution of the script until the spawned program has finished use the RunWait function instead. The error property is set to 1 as an indication of failure.

runAsSet

public int runAsSet(java.lang.String username,
                    java.lang.String domain,
                    java.lang.String password,
                    int options)
Initialize a set of user credentials to use during Run and RunWait operations. 2000/XP or later ONLY.

Parameters:
username - The user name to use.
domain - The domain name to use.
password - The password to use.
options - 0 = do not load the user profile, 1 = (default) load the user profile, 2 = use for net credentials only
Returns:
Returns 0 if the operating system does not support this function. Otherwise returns 1--regardless of success. (If the login information was invalid, subsequent Run/RunWait commands will fail....)

runAsSet

runWait

public int runWait(java.lang.String filename,
                   java.lang.String workingDirectory,
                   int flag)
Runs an external program and pauses script execution until the program finishes.

Parameters:
filename - The name of the executable (EXE, BAT, COM, PIF) to run.
workingDirectory - The working directory.
flag - The "show" flag of the executed program:
SW_HIDE = Hidden window
SW_MINIMIZE = Minimized window
SW_MAXIMIZE = Maximized window
Returns:
Returns the exit code of the program that was run. The error property is set to 1 as an indication of failure.

Parameters:

shutdown

public boolean shutdown(int code)
Shuts down the system.

Parameters:
code - The shutdown code is a combination of the following values:
0 = Logoff
1 = Shutdown
2 = Reboot
4 = Force
8 = Power down Add the required values together. To shutdown and power down, for example, the code would be 9 (shutdown + power down = 1 + 8 = 9).
Returns:
True if success, false otherwise.

regDeleteKey

public int regDeleteKey(java.lang.String keyname)
Deletes a key from the registry.

Parameters:
keyname - The registry key to write to.
Returns:
Success: Returns 1. Special: Returns 0 if the key does not exist. Failure: Returns 2 if error deleting key.

regDeleteVal

public int regDeleteVal(java.lang.String keyname)
Deletes a value from the registry.

Parameters:
keyname - The registry key to write to.
Returns:
Success: Returns 1. Special: Returns 0 if the key does not exist. Failure: Returns 2 if error deleting key.

regEnumKey

public java.lang.String regEnumKey(java.lang.String keyname,
                                   int instance)
Reads the name of a subkey according to it's instance.

Parameters:
keyname - The registry key to read.
instance - The 1-based key instance to retrieve.
Returns:
Success: Returns the requested subkey name. Otherwise Returns "" and sets the .error() flag, 1 if unable to open requested key, -1 if unable to retrieve requested subkey (key instance out of range)

regEnumVal

                                   int instance)

Parameters:
keyname - The registry key to read.
instance - The 1-based key instance to retrieve.
Returns:

regRead

public java.lang.String regRead(java.lang.String keyname,
                                java.lang.String valueName)
Reads the name of a value according to it's instance.

Parameters:
keyname - The registry key to read.
valueName - The registry value to read.
Returns:
Success:Returns the requested registry value value. Otherwise Returns numeric 1 and sets the oAutoIt.error flag:
1 if unable to open requested key
-1 if unable to open requested value
-2 if value type not supported

regWrite

public boolean regWrite(java.lang.String keyname,
                        java.lang.String valueName,
                        java.lang.String type,
                        java.lang.String value)
Creates a key or value in the registry.

Parameters:
keyname - The registry key to write to. If no other parameters are specified this key will simply be created.
valueName - The valuename to write to.
type - Type of key to write: "REG_SZ", "REG_MULTI_SZ", "REG_EXPAND_SZ", "REG_DWORD", or "REG_BINARY".
value - The value to write.
Returns:
True if success, false otherwise.

controlEnable

public boolean controlEnable(java.lang.String title,
                             java.lang.String text,
                             java.lang.String control)
Enables a "grayed-out" control. Use with caution. When using a control name in the Control functions, you need to add a number to the end of the name to indicate which control. For example, if there two controls listed called "MDIClient", you would refer to these as "MDIClient1" and "MDIClient2".

Parameters:
title - The title of the window to access.
text - The text of the window to access.
control - The control to interact with.
Returns:
True if success, false otherwise.

controlListViewGetSelected

public java.lang.String controlListViewGetSelected(java.lang.String title,
                                                   java.lang.String text,
                                                   java.lang.String control)
Returns a string containing the item index of selected items. If option=0 (default) only the first selected item is returned. If option=1 then all the selected items are returned delimited by |, e.g: "0|3|4|10". If no items are selected a blank "" string is returned.

Parameters:
title - The title of the window to access.
text - The text of the window to access.
control - The control to interact with.
Returns:
Returns a string containing the item index of selected items. If option=0 (default) only the first selected item is returned. If option=1 then all the selected items are returned delimited by |, e.g: "0|3|4|10". If no items are selected a blank "" string is returned.

controlListViewGetSelectedArray

public java.lang.String[] controlListViewGetSelectedArray(java.lang.String title,
                                                          java.lang.String text,
                                                          java.lang.String control)
Returns a string containing the item index of selected items. If option=0 (default) only the first selected item is returned. If option=1 then all the selected items are returned delimited by |, e.g: "0|3|4|10". If no items are selected a blank "" string is returned. If no items are selected a blank "" string is returned.

Parameters:
title - The title of the window to access.
text - The text of the window to access.
control - The control to interact with.
Returns:
Returns a string containing the item index of selected items. If option=0 (default) only the first selected item is returned. If option=1 then all the selected items are returned delimited by |, e.g: "0|3|4|10". If no items are selected a blank "" string is returned.

public java.lang.String statusbarGetText(java.lang.String title,
                                         java.lang.String text,
                                         int part)
Retrieves the text from a standard status bar control.

Parameters:
title - The title of the window to check.
text - The text of the window to check.
part - The "part" number of the status bar to read - the default is 1. 1 is the first possible part and usually the one that contains the useful messages like "Ready" "Loading...", etc.
Returns:
The text from a standard status bar control.

Returns:
Returns a value indicating the state of the window. Multiple values are added together so use BitAND() to examine the part you are interested in: 1 = Window exists 2 = Window is visible 4 = Windows is enabled 8 = Window is active 16 = Window is minimized otherwise returns 0 and sets oAutoIt.error to 1 if the window is not found.

winGetState

public int winGetState(java.lang.String title)
Retrieves the state of a given window.

Parameters:
title - The title of the window to read.
Returns:
Returns a value indicating the state of the window. Multiple values are added together so use BitAND() to examine the part you are interested in:
1 = Window exists
2 = Window is visible
4 = Windows is enabled
8 = Window is active
16 = Window is minimized
otherwise returns 0 and sets oAutoIt.error to 1 if the window is not found.

winGetText

public java.lang.String winGetText(java.lang.String title,
                                   java.lang.String text)
Retrieves up to 64KB of text from a window.

WinGetText works on minimized windows, but only works on hidden windows if you've set AutoItSetOption("WinDetectHiddenText", 1) If multiple windows match the criteria for WinGetText, the information for the most recently active match is returned. Use WinGetText("") to get the active window's text.

Parameters:
title - The title of the window to read.
text - The text of the window to read.
Returns:
Returns a string containing up to 64k of the window text read.

winGetText

public java.lang.String winGetText(java.lang.String title)
Retrieves up to 64KB of text from a window.

WinGetText works on minimized windows, but only works on hidden windows if you've set AutoItSetOption("WinDetectHiddenText", 1) If multiple windows match the criteria for WinGetText, the information for the most recently active match is returned. Use WinGetText("") to get the active window's text.

Parameters:
title - The title of the window to read.
Returns:
Returns a string containing up to 64k of the window text read.

                        boolean isTopMost)

winSetState

public void winSetState(java.lang.String title,
                        java.lang.String text,
                        int flag)
Shows, hides, minimizes, maximizes, or restores a window.

Parameters:
title - The title of the window to affect.
text - The text of the window to affect.
flag - The "show" flag of the executed program:
SW_HIDE = Hide window,
SW_SHOW = Shows a previously hidden window,
SW_MINIMIZE = Minimize window,
SW_MAXIMIZE = Maximize window,
SW_RESTORE = Undoes a window minimization or maximization.

winSetTrans

public boolean winSetTrans(java.lang.String title,
                           java.lang.String text,
                           int transparency)
Sets the transparency of a window. (Windows 2000/XP or later)

Parameters:
title - The title of the window to affect.
text - The text of the window to affect.
transparency - A number in the range 0 - 255. The larger the number, the more transparent the window will become.
Returns:
True on success, false on failure. .error() will be set to 1 if the function isn't supported on an OS.
